snippet: The album has 12 songs, among them ones that praised the Dalai Lama, the exiled spiritual leader of the Tibetans, and the scores of Tibetans who have set themselves on fire since 2009 to protest Chinese rule.
abstract: Pema Trinlay and Chakdor, Tibetan musicians detained in 2012 by Chinese security officers, are sentenced to two years in prison.
lead_paragraph: The album has 12 songs, among them ones that praised the Dalai Lama, the exiled spiritual leader of the Tibetans, and the scores of Tibetans who have set themselves on fire since 2009 to protest Chinese rule.

headline.main: Prison Sentence for 2 Musicians Who Released Album of Protest Songs
headline.print_headline: Tibet: Prison Sentence for 2 Musicians Who Released Album of Protest Songs
